channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14199] maven-remote-resources-plugin failure processing NOTICE.vm in hbase-assembly
item.description:
Only seen when building 0.98 with -Dhadoop.profile=1.1. Happens with both JDK 6 and 7. 

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-remote-resources-plugin:1.5:process

(default) on project hbase-assembly: Error rendering velocity resource. Error invoking method

'get(java.lang.Integer)' in java.util.ArrayList at META-INF/NOTICE.vm[line 275, column 22]:

InvocationTargetException: Index: 0, Size: 0 -> [Help 1]
item.summary: maven-remote-resources-plugin failure processing NOTICE.vm in hbase-assembly

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Full stack trace

Caused by: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0

	at java.util.ArrayList.RangeCheck(ArrayList.java:547)

	at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:322)

In NOTICE.vm, the problem is here:

#if(${dep.artifactId.equals("jruby-complete")})

#set($jruby=true)

#end

----> #if( !(${dep.licenses[0].name.contains("BSD")} || ${dep.licenses[0].name.contains("MIT")}) )

#if( !(${dep.licenses[0].name.equals("Public Domain")}) )

#if( !(${dep.licenses[0].name.contains("Apache Software License, Version 2.0")}) )

#set($aggregated = false)

#if(${dep.licenses[0].name.contains("CDDL")})

#if(${dep.licenses[0].name.contains("1.0")})

#set($aggregated = $cddl_1_0.add($dep))

#elseif(${dep.licenses[0].name.contains("1.1")})

#set($aggregated = $cddl_1_1.add($dep))

#end

#end

#if(${dep.licenses[0].name.equalsIgnoreCase("Common Public License Version 1.0")})

#set($aggregated = $cpl_1_0.add($dep))

#end

#if(${dep.licenses[0].name.equalsIgnoreCase("Mozilla Public License Version 1.1")})

#set($aggregated = $mpl_1_1.add($dep))

#end

Let me see about hacking something to get over this hump.
Here's a patch that treats the symptom. The 'licenses' property for some projects is a zero length array. Only happens when building against Hadoop 1.
Scratch that patch, figured out I need to update supplemental-models. Back in a sec

Here's an updated patch that adds a supplemental model for org.apache.hadoop:hadoop-core for 0.98 when compiling against the Hadoop 1 profile. Also protects against ArrayOutOfBounds exceptions when processing velocity macros for included works without available license data. A review of debug output will still detect the problem.

I've attached a patch for master and 0.98 but the master patch will apply everywhere.

Sean Busbey
Can I commit this? At least the addition to supplemental-models.xml.

My apologies that neither of my emailed comments came to this ticket. Also that my notes in the velocity templates didn't make it more obvious that the issue was a need to update supplemental models.

I'd like to find a way to fail the build with a meaningful message when a license is missing so we don't slide so far again. Maybe use a property to determine if it's a failure condition and the set it to true on Jenkins and in the release profile?

I'd like to find a way to fail the build with a meaningful message when a license is missing so we don't slide so far again. Maybe use a property to determine if it's a failure condition and the set it to true on Jenkins and in the release profile?

Sure, if I can figure out how to conditionally fail the build depending on a property from within velocity we could do that. Will look into it. Otherwise I'd like to consider the patch I've attached on this issue because the AOBE will have people assuming Maven or velocity is broken. My first reaction was to consider looking for more recent released versions of the build plugins.
so long as there's a ticket filed against 2.0 for failing the build when a license is missing, I'm +1 on the current patch.

Updated 'HBASE-14199.patch' applies to all branches. Velocity is really restricted, I don't think we can do better than AOBE to signal something is wrong in a way that fails the build. New patch only adds the supplemental model for Hadoop 1 for 0.98.

Although the patch applies to all branches, we only support Hadoop 1 with 0.98, so I pushed this there only. Let me know if you want it in more places. Tested a Hadoop 1 profile build and assembly before pushing. Resolving.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.98 #1073 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98/1073/)
HBASE-14199 maven-remote-resources-plugin failure processing NOTICE.vm in hbase-assembly (apurtell: rev a9a7582958f6a9aee711b9a264d89669baa390bf)

  • hbase-resource-bundle/src/main/resources/supplemental-models.xml

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #1027 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/1027/)
HBASE-14199 maven-remote-resources-plugin failure processing NOTICE.vm in hbase-assembly (apurtell: rev a9a7582958f6a9aee711b9a264d89669baa390bf)

  • hbase-resource-bundle/src/main/resources/supplemental-models.xml

Pushed the fix to master branch.

Saw similar error in recent QA reports, e.g. in HBASE-14309

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6760 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6760/)
HBASE-14199 maven-remote-resources-plugin failure processing NOTICE.vm in hbase-assembly (Andrew Purtell) (tedyu: rev aa938c738a1a6378783eed1b1145a097fd062c20)

  • hbase-resource-bundle/src/main/resources/supplemental-models.xml

-1 for master. Ted Yu please revert.

As I stated earlier in this ticket, just making it so the build doesn't break when a dependency doesn't have proper licensing will lead us directly back to the situation where we lose 2 months in our release cadence. If the failure showed up in QA, was it because something we incorrect or because we should have failed because of a license error?

Reverted.

Let's find out what proper licensing should be added so that QA can be unblocked.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6761 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6761/)
HBASE-14199 Revert according to Sean's feedback (tedyu: rev 8f95318f6252c1c0b7a073619525eae6d991f47b)

  • hbase-resource-bundle/src/main/resources/supplemental-models.xml

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
I am facing this issue while trying to compile HBase 1.1.2 against Hadoop 2.7.1. If this patch is not working what is the right fix for this?

Sumeetkumar Maru, please email user@ or dev@ for troubleshooting help. Most folks don't get notifications from closed issues.

the short answer to your question is to use -Dlicense.debug.print.included=true and then to examine the generated LICENSE file to see what transitive dependency of Hadoop 2.7.1 doesn't have license information.
